dublin_core.dcvalue: The DICOM standard defines in detail how medical images can be communicated However the rules on how to interpret the parameters contained in a DICOM image which deal with the image presentation were either lacking or not well defined As a result the same image frequently looks different when displayed on different workstations or printed on a film from various printers Three new DICOM extensions attempt to close this gap by defining a comprehensive model for the display of images on softcopy and hardcopy devices Grayscale Standard Display Function Grayscale Softcopy Presentation State and Presentation Look Up Table
Studies in health technology and informatics
New DICOM extensions for softcopy and hardcopy display consistency.
